revision.comment: Adding custom [[Wikipedia:Short description|short description]]: "Angolan singer/songwriter (born 1986)" ([[Wikipedia:Shortdesc helper|Shortdesc helper]])
revision.text:
{{Short description|Angolan singer/songwriter (born 1986)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=January 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Neide Van-Dúnem | image = Neide Van-Dúnem.jpg | caption = | birth_name = Neide Núria de Sousa Van-Dúnem Vieira | alias = Neide
Neide Van | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1986|7|4}} | origin = [[Luanda, Angola|Luanda]], Angola | instrument = Vocal | genre = [[Kizomba]]
[[Semba]]
[[R&B]] | occupation = Theatre producer, actress, singer, song writer | years_active = 2006–present | label = Independent | website = {{url|www.neidevandunem.com}} }} '''Neide Núria de Sousa Van-Dúnem Vieira''' (born July 4, 1986),{{cite web|URL=http://platinaline.com/index.php/contacto/item/600-entrevista-exclusiva-neide-van-d%C3%BAnem/600-entrevista-exclusiva-neide-van-d%C3%BAnem|title=Entrevista exclusiva – Neide Van-Dúnem|language=Portuguese|date=January 18, 2016|accessdate=January 28, 2016|publisher=Platina Line}} also known as '''Neide''', is a popular Angolan contemporary singer, songwriter, and film/television actress. Born and raised in [[Luanda, Angola]], Neide started her acting career in local theater in 2003, at the age of 17, being cast in the television soap "Sede de Viver" a year later. Her singing career officially began in 2007 with the release of the hit single "Olá Baby" in the compilation album ''Eu e Elas (vol 1)'', a song for which the video reached the number two spot on the [[MTV Africa]] Video Chart. == Early life == Neide was born on July 4, 1986, in [[Luanda]], [[Angola]] and is the [[only child]] of José António Vieira and Isabel Maria de Fátima Sousa Van-Dúnem, although she has three half-brothers and six half-sisters. Neide's interest in music came at a very early age although it was as an actress at age 17 that she would have her first encounter with fame. But she eventually broke into the music scene in 2007 with the release of the hit single "Olá Baby". == Recording career == === 2006–2007: ''Olá Baby'' === In collaboration with producer Caló Pascoal, Neide's initial venture into the music business came in the form of a duet with the producer on the song "Olá Baby", the lead single of the compilation album ''Eu e Elas (vol 1)'' released on April 29, 2007. The song's commercial success launched Neide's singing career and established her as a "double threat" in the entertainment business (singing and acting). {{listen |filename=Ola Baby.ogg |title='''Olá Baby''' (.ogg file) |description=Neide's first single (2007), from the compilation album ''Eu e Elas (vol 1)'' }} ===2008–2009: ''Teu Marido Casou/Esta Noite''=== Neide decided to put her acting career on hold to venture forth as an independent artist and started working on her debut solo album, writing all of its tracks. The music styles she employed were primarily [[Kizomba]] and [[Semba]] but the influence of [[R&B]] is strong. "Teu Marido Casou (com outra)" was the first song to get radio play, to be later released as a CD single along with the song "Esta Noite". The full album was scheduled to be released in the second half of 2009 but its release was postponed. {{listen |filename=Teu Marido Casou.ogg |title='''Teu Marido Casou (com outra)'''(.ogg file) |description=Lead single from Neide's 2009 self-titled debut solo album. }} ==Discography== * 2009: ''[[Teu Marido Casou/Esta Noite]]'' ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" ! Year !! Title !! Role !! Notes |- | 2008 || ''Momentos de Glória'' || || Short movie |- |} ===Television=== {|class="wikitable" ! Year || Title || Role || Notes |- | 2008 || ''Para Além do Preconceito'' || || |- | 2006–2007 || ''Sede de Viver (TV series)|Sede de Viver'' || Anita Bronca || |- |} == External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090402145513/http://www.neidevandunem.com/ Official Web Site] * [http://neidevandunem.hi5.com Neide Van-Dúnem] at [[Hi5 (website)|Hi5]] * [http://www.mwangole.net Portal da Música Angolana] * [http://www.museke.com/en/node/2804 Neide Van-Dunem lyrics, audio, video] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Van-Dunem, Neide}} [[Category:1986 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:21st-century Angolan women singers]] [[Category:People from Luanda]] [[Category:Portuguese-language singers]] [[Category:Angolan songwriters]]

{{short description|Japanese idol from the eighties (born 1966)}} {{Infobox person | name = Mamiko Takai | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1966|12|28}}{{Harvnb|ino|2003|p=37}}{{Harvnb|bomb|1986|p=24}} | birth_place = [[Obama, Fukui|Obama]], [[Fukui Prefecture]], [[Japan]]{{Harvnb|ino|2003|p=37}} | nationality = | other_names = | known_for = | occupation = Singer and Actress | spouse = [[Yasushi Akimoto]] (1988–present){{cite web |title=30年前の本日7月7日、おニャン子クラブの高井麻巳子のソロ・デビュー曲「シンデレラたちへの伝言」がチャート1位を獲得 |trans-title=Thirty years ago on July 7, Mamiko Takai of Onyanko Club's solo debut song " Message to Cinderellas" reached No. 1 on the charts |url=https://news.1242.com/article/100818 |language=ja | publisher=[[Nippon Broadcasting System]] |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |date=2016-07-07 |access-date=2022-05-29}} }} '''Mamiko Takai''' (高井麻巳子, Takai Mamiko, born December 28, 1966 in [[Obama, Fukui|Obama]], [[Fukui Prefecture|Fukui]], [[Japan]]) is a [[Japanese idol]] from the eighties, who debuted in 1985 with the [[J-pop]] girl band [[Onyanko Club]], and its first sub-group, duo [[Ushiroyubi Sasaregumi]] with her co-worker [[Yukiko Iwai (Onyanko Club)|Yukiko Iwai]].{{Harvnb|ino|2003|p=37}} She quit those two bands in 1987, becoming a solo artist, and released four albums before marrying producer [[Yasushi Akimoto]] and subsequently retiring.{{Harvnb|ino|2003|p=37}} Her older sister Masayo made her record debut in July 1986 as a part of a 20-member dance group named {{nihongo|Dee-Dee|[[:ja:Dee-Dee|Dee-Dee]]}}.{{cite magazine |editor-last=Akasaka |editor-first=Shigeru |date=1986-08-01 |title=男区新聞 |trans-title=DUNK multi news |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|DUNK|[[:ja:DUNK (雑誌)|DUNK]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Shūeisha]] |issue=August 1986 |page=51}} She has two other younger sisters.{{Harvnb|bomb|1986|p=38-39}} == Biography == Takai's family owned a [[local bike shop]]. She played [[softball]] at {{nihongo|Obama Municipal Junior High School|[[:ja:小浜市立小浜中学校|小浜市立小浜中学]]}}.{{Harvnb|bomb|1986|p=28}} After entering {{nihongo|Fukui Prefectural Wakasa High School|[[:ja:福井県立若狭高等学校|福井県立若狭高校]]}}, she became popular among the students and was dubbed {{nihongo|''Miss Jakkō''|ミス若高|Misu Jakkō}} (Jakkō is an abbreviation for Wakasa High School).{{Harvnb|bomb|1986|p=30}} At that time, she dreamed of becoming an actress in the future. After graduating from high school, she moved to [[Tokyo]] to attend [[Joshibi University of Art and Design Junior College|Joshibi Junior College]].{{Harvnb|sakama|1987|p=70}}{{cite web |title=高井麻巳子の現在。娘がAKBの噂。実家はファンの聖地だった |trans-title=Mamiko Takai's current status. Her daughter is rumored to be in AKB. Her family home was a sanctuary for fans |url=https://asuneta.com/archives/40854 |language=ja |publisher=Byron-bay |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |date=2021-02-01 |access-date=2022-05-29}} On April 15, 1985, she was approached by Katsunobu Itō ([[:ja:伊藤克信|伊藤克信]], Itō Katsunobu), a reporter for the variety show {{nihongo|"Yūyake Nyan Nyan"(Sunset Meow Meow)|[[:ja:夕やけニャンニャン|夕やけニャンニャン]]}}, while she was shopping in [[Harajuku]]. This led to an audition for that show, which was accepted, and she became a member of Onyanko Club. Note that since she already was affiliated with an entertainment agency, some say that her being approached in Harajuku was a staged act disguised as a coincidence. She became a center of attention as soon as she joined Onyanko Club because she was considered a legitimate beauty.{{Harvnb|ino|2003|p=52-53}} In October 1985, she teamed up with Yukiko Iwai and made their record debut as Ushiroyubi Sasaregumi. In June 1986, she made her solo debut with the song {{nihongo|"Cinderella-tachi e no Dengon"|[[:ja:シンデレラたちへの伝言|シンデレラたちへの伝言]]}}, which became number one on the [[Oricon]] chart in its first appearance.{{Harvnb|bomb|1986|p=32-34}} This song was very different from [[surrealistic]] [[novelty songs]] of Ushiroyubi Sasaregumi, and was a [[ballad]] with a calm and quiet tone.{{Harvnb|ino|2003|p=70-76}} Since then, three more of her songs reached number one in a row. On July 6, 1986, a large-scale {{nihongo|''Handshake Event''|握手会|Akushukai}} was held at [[Osaka-jō Hall]] and she shook hands with 16,000 fans who gathered there.{{Harvnb|iwakiri|1987|p=170-173}}{{cite magazine |editor-last=Akasaka |editor-first=Shigeru |date=1986-09-01 |title=MAMIKO新聞 |trans-title=MAMIKO TIMES |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|DUNK|[[:ja:DUNK (雑誌)|DUNK]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Shūeisha]] |issue=September 1986 |page=15-18}} In October 1986, her radio program, {{nihongo|''Smiling Message''|微笑伝言・ほほえみメッセージ|Bishōdengon Hohoemimessēji}}, was launched on [[Nippon Broadcasting System]].{{Harvnb|iwakiri|1987|p=176}} In December 1986, [[Toho|Tōhō]] premiered the movie {{nihongo|''Women in love''|[[:ja:恋する女たち (氷室冴子)|恋する女たち]]}}, in which she co-starred with [[Yuki Saito (actress)|Yuki Saitō]] and [[Haruko Sagara]].{{Harvnb|iwakiri|1987|p=136}} In this film she played the role of a fun-loving [[disco]] queen. In reality, however, she had never been to a disco, and her character was considered to be sober and reserved, the opposite of a playful person, which made her role terribly perplexing to her fans.{{Harvnb|bomb|1986|p=42-45}} She also starred in the idol dramas {{nihongo|''Daddy Longlegs''|あしながおじさん|Ashinaga Ojisan}} and {{nihongo|''Secret Half Moon''|ないしょのハーフムーン|Naisho no Hāfumūn}}. In April 1987, she graduated from Onyanko Club along with [[Sayuri Kokushō]], [[Nyangilas|Aki Kihara]], [[Nyangilas|Rika Tatsumi]], and Kazuko Utsumi ([[:ja:内海和子|内海和子]], Utsumi Kazuko).{{Harvnb|iwakiri|1987|p=141}} Along with this, Ushiroyubi Sasaregumi also disbanded.{{cite magazine |editor-last=Akasaka |editor-first=Shigeru |date=1987-05-01 |title=サンバで"かしこ"申し上げます |trans-title=We do say "Kashiko" with samba |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|DUNK|[[:ja:DUNK (雑誌)|DUNK]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Shūeisha]] |issue=March 1987 |page=16-17}} She mentioned that Onyanko Club's first concert, held at [[Hibiya Open-Air Concert Hall]] in October 1985, was one of the most memorable events for her as a member of the group.{{cite magazine |editor-last=Akasaka |editor-first=Shigeru |date=1987-02-01 |title=樹原亜紀・国生さゆり・内海和子・立見里歌・高井麻巳子 3月に卒業 |trans-title=Aki Kihara, Sayuri Kokushō, Kazuko Utsumi, Rika Tatsumi, and Mamiko Takai to graduate in March |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|DUNK|[[:ja:DUNK (雑誌)|DUNK]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Shūeisha]] |issue=february 1987 |page=37}} She then became a solo singer and actress.{{cite magazine |editor-last=Akasaka |editor-first=Shigeru |date=1987-10-01 |title=月刊 麻巳子新聞 |trans-title=Monthly MAMIKO TIMES |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|DUNK|[[:ja:DUNK (雑誌)|DUNK]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Shūeisha]] |issue=October 1987 |page=120}} She was oriented more toward acting than singing. As an actress, she appeared in dramas such as {{nihongo|''Wait until it's hot''|熱くなるまで待って|Atsukunarumade Matte}} and {{nihongo|''The stories of the snapping anchors''|アナウンサーぷっつん物語|Anaunsā Puttsunmonogatari}}. In addition, she starred in the drama {{nihongo|''The Wizard of Oba''|オバの魔法使い|Oba no Mahōtsukai}}. In July 1987, she released two videos: a feature-length promotional video titled {{nihongo|''Clockwork Fantômas''|時計仕掛けの小悪魔(ファントマ)|Tokeijikake no Fantoma}} filmed in [[Southern Europe]] and a video titled {{nihongo|''Mamiko Takai First Concert DO・RA・MA''|高井麻巳子ファースト・コンサート DO・RA・MA|Takai Mamiko Fāsuto Konsāto Dorama}} featuring her first solo concert at [[NHK Hall]] in June of that year.{{Harvnb|iwakiri|1987|p=163-165}} She also published a photo book titled {{nihongo|''Soleil''|ソレイユ|Soreiyu}}, taken in Southern Europe. On May 23, 1988, just three weeks after the official fan club was formed, she married Yasushi Akimoto and retired from the entertainment industry.{{cite magazine |editor-last=Akasaka |editor-first=Shigeru |date=1988-05-01 |title=麻巳ちゃんのファンクラブが、ついにできたぞ！ |trans-title=Mami-Chan's fan club is finally here! |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|DUNK|[[:ja:DUNK (雑誌)|DUNK]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Shūeisha]] |issue=May 1988 |page=67}}{{cite magazine |editor-last=Komukai |editor-first=Shōji |date=1988-07-01 |title=高井麻巳子引退→結婚！！ |trans-title=Mamiko Takai retires → Marriage!! |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|BOMB|[[:ja:BOMB|BOMB]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Gakken]] |issue=July 1988 |page=58}} They then lived in [[New York City|New York]] for a year and a half. In March 2001, after 13 years of marriage, she finally had a baby girl. In the 2000s, she published three books of essays on food under the name of Mamiko Akimoto: {{nihongo|''Ordering for two people living together''|二人暮らしのお取り寄せ|Futarigurashi no Otoriyose}}, {{nihongo|''Sweets to order at tea time''|お茶の時間のお取り寄せ|Ocha no Jikan no Otoriyose}}, and {{nihongo|''Happy Orders''|幸福のお取り寄せ|Kōfuku no Otoriyose}}.{{cite web |title=安倍首相も唸った？ 秋元康の妻・麻巳子の"おもてなし力" |trans-title=Was Prime Minister Abe also impressed by the " Omotenashi" of Mamiko, Yasushi Akimoto's wife? |url=https://ddnavi.com/news/169350/a/ |language=ja |publisher=[[Kadokawa Shoten]] |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |date=2013-11-06 |access-date=2022-05-29}} Moreover, in December 2002, she and her husband published a picture book titled {{nihongo|''Elephant Cat''|ぞうネコ|Zouneko}}. In October 2013, they invited [[Shinzō Abe]], then [[Prime Minister]], to their home and served him dinner. She also became an statutory auditor of Yasushi Akimoto's office. == Relationship with Yukiko Iwai == She and Yukiko Iwai, who were partnered in Ushiroyubi Sasaregumi, were said by those around them to be not on good terms with each other.{{Harvnb|iwakiri|1987|p=43}}{{cite web |title=高井麻巳子、斉藤由貴は親友？ゆうゆとは不仲だった？あと不仲だったメンバーはだれ？ |trans-title=Is Makiko Takai a close friend of Yuki Saitō? Did she not get along with Yūyu? Who were the other members she didn't get along with? |url=https://asuneta.com/archives/41718 |language=ja |publisher=Byron-bay |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |date=2020-06-01 |access-date=2022-05-29}} However, at least in the early days, it is considered otherwise.{{cite magazine |editor-last=Akasaka |editor-first=Shigeru |date=1987-05-01 |title=サンバで"かしこ"申し上げます |trans-title=We do say "Kashiko" with Samba |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|DUNK|[[:ja:DUNK (雑誌)|DUNK]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Shūeisha]] |issue=March 1987 |page=16-17}} They often took a cab home together after appearing on Yūyake Nyan Nyan at the time, since they were going home in the same direction. When Ushiroyubi Sasaregumi disbanded, they both said that it was a very pleasant memory and that they loved this subgroup. Kazuji Kasai, chief director of Yūyake Nyan Nyan, supervisor of Onyanko Club, explained the relationship between the two as follows. "This subgroup was originally formed by our decision without regard to their wishes. So it is true that there were differences in orientation between the two, but they were not as incompatible as they were said to be." However, Iwai subsequently admitted on a TV program that she and Takai did not get along well. She mentioned that since they were in different groups, they spent little time together and had no conversations with each other outside of work.{{cite magazine |editor-last=Igarashi |editor-first=Takao |date=1987-07-01 |title=楽屋交遊録 |trans-title=Back stage friendship |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|Deluxe Magazine|[[:ja:DELUXEマガジン|Ore]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Kodansha]] |issue=July 1987 |page=41}} Iwai felt that Takai was privileged by Akimoto, which was also not amusing to her.{{cite magazine |last=Kanai |first=Satoru |date=1996-04-03 |title=おニャン子の10年 |trans-title=The Decade of Onyanko |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|Takarajima|[[:ja:宝島 (雑誌)|宝島]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Takarajimasha]] |issue=April 3, 1996 |page=38}} Iwai made a curt comment about the successive marriages of Takai and Ruriko Nagata ([[:ja:永田ルリ子|永田ルリ子]], Nagata Ruriko), saying that they should not have rushed into marriage since they were only 21 years old.{{cite magazine |editor-last=Yasui |editor-first=Makoto |date=1988-08-01 |title=アイドルベストナイン |trans-title=Idol Best 9 |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|BOMB|[[:ja:BOMB|BOMB]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Gakken]] |issue=August 1988 |pages=64}} Note that [[Eri Nitta]], one of the most popular members of Onyanko Club, considered Takai to be one of her best friends.{{cite magazine |editor-last=Akasaka |editor-first=Shigeru |date=1986-11-01 |title=映画に連れてってくれる彼氏募集してまーすっ!! |trans-title=I'm looking for a boyfriend to take me to the movies!! |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|DUNK|[[:ja:DUNK (雑誌)|DUNK]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Shūeisha]] |issue=November 1986 |page=200}} On the other hand, Takai herself recalled that when she was in Onyanko Club, there were no members she was particularly close to, and she was frequently alone. == Takai's characteristics and Yasushi Akimoto == Many of Takai's fans interpreted her sudden marriage as Akimoto forcibly taking her away from them. Although they directed their uncontrollable anger toward Akimoto, sometimes even directly harassing him, they accepted this fact over time. In the summer of 1986, she was secretly being stalked by the [[paparazzi]] of the photo magazine [[Friday (magazine)|Friday]], which was brought to her attention by one of her most enthusiastic fans.{{Harvnb|Kasai|Akimoto|1986|p=66}} She was also stalked by Akimoto when she and Aki Kihara went to see the movie [[Year of the Dragon (film)|Year of the Dragon]] at midnight.{{Harvnb|Kasai|Akimoto|1986|p=29}}{{Harvnb|bomb|1986|p=41}} On this occasion, Akimoto approached Takai at the movie theater, feigning coincidence. On the other hand, actress Yuki Saitō, who admits to being Takai's close friend, In her collection of essays, {{nihongo|''About people whom I like''|私の好きなあの人のコト|watashi no Sukina Anohitonokoto}}, she claimed that, contrary to popular perception, Takai was in fact actively courting Akimoto. He wrote many lyrics for the members of Onyanko Club, but only one song was written for her. In addition, when Akimoto talked with her in the summer of 1986, he made the following comments about her.{{Harvnb|bomb|1986|p=47-48}} "She is naive because she was nurtured by the warm love of her family. Such characteristics of hers make her very clean image stand out in the greasy entertainment industry. While [[Sonoko Kawai]] and Eri Nitta will definitely have affairs, she will never commit adultery." In July 1985, when the members of Onyanko Club stayed at a hotel near {{nihongo|Oiso Long Beach|[[:ja:大磯ロングビーチ|大磯ロングビーチ]]}} in [[Ōiso]], [[Kanagawa Prefecture|Kanagawa]], While all of them excitedly watched the [[pornographic film|pornographic videos]], the "pure-hearted" Takai was the only one who was shocked into silence by them.{{Harvnb|Kasai|Akimoto|1986|p=51}}{{cite magazine |editor-last=Akasaka |editor-first=Shigeru |date=1986-03-01 |title=顔よりも性格重視 |trans-title=More concerned with pesonalities than looks |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|DUNK|[[:ja:DUNK (雑誌)|DUNK]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Shūeisha]] |issue=March 1986 |page=65}}{{cite magazine |editor-last=Igarashi |editor-first=Takao |date=1986-09-01 |title=おニャン子㊙ ぶっちゃけ新事実 |trans-title=Onyanko Secrets: New facts without reservation |language=ja |magazine={{nihongo|Deluxe Magazine|[[:ja:DELUXEマガジン|Ore]]}} |location=[[Tokyo, Japan]] |publisher=[[Kōdansha]] |issue=September 1986 |pages=64}} She was considered by the members of Onyanko Club to be the most feminine of the group.{{Harvnb|Kasai|Akimoto|1986|p=53}} Her plain, unassuming, ordinary manner was described as her greatest appeal. On the other hand, Akimoto and others described her as having an awkward and quirky side, despite her calm outward appearance.{{Harvnb|sakama|1987|p=51,70}} == Singles == {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year !! Title !! Details !! Peak chart
position ([[Oricon]]) |- | rowspan="3" | 1986 || {{Nihongo|"Cinderella-tachi e no Dengon"|シンデレラたちへの伝言}} || * Released: June 25, 1986 * B-side: {{Nihongo|"Kowarekaketa Piano"|こわれかけたピアノ}} || {{center|#1}} |- | {{Nihongo|"Melody"|メロディ}} || * Released: September 21, 1986 * B-side: {{Nihongo|"Toki no Tsugegoto"|時のつげごと}} || {{center|#1}} |- | {{Nihongo|"Yakusoku"|約束}} || * Released: December 21, 1986 * B-side: {{Nihongo|"Haru wa Na Nomi"|春は名のみ}} || {{center|#1}} |- | rowspan="4" | 1987 || {{Nihongo|"Kagerō"|かげろう}} || * Released: March 18, 1987 * B-side: {{Nihongo|"Nemuri no Opera"|眠りのオペラ}} || {{center|#1}} |- | {{Nihongo|"Jōnetsu Rainbow"|情熱れいんぼう}} || * Released: June 10, 1987 * B-side: {{Nihongo|"Yūgure no Piano"|夕暮れのピアノ}} || {{center|#2}} |- | {{Nihongo|"Usotsuki"|うそつき}} || * Released: September 21, 1987 * B-side: {{Nihongo|"Jūgatsu no Tabibito"|十月の旅人}} || {{center|#2}} |- | {{Nihongo|"Tender Rain"|テンダー・レイン}} || * Released: December 16, 1987 * B-side: {{Nihongo|"Hoshi no Seseragi"|星のせせらぎ}} || {{center|#3}} |- | 1988 || {{Nihongo|"Komorebi no Season"|木洩れ陽のシーズン}} || * Released: April 6, 1988 * B-side: {{Nihongo|"Kegarenaki Itazura"|汚れなき悪戯}} || {{center|#12}} |} == Albums == === Studio albums === * {{Nihongo|''Itoguchi''|いとぐち}} (1987) * {{Nihongo|''Kokoro Biyori''|こころ日和}} (1987) * {{Nihongo|''Watashi no Mama de...''|私のままで…}} (1988) * ''Message'' (1988) === Compilation albums === * {{Nihongo|''My Kore!''|Myこれ!}} series ** {{Nihongo|''My Kore! Ction: Takai Mamiko BEST''|Myこれ!クション 高井麻巳子BEST}} (2002) ** {{Nihongo|''My Kore! Lite: Takai Mamiko''|Myこれ!Lite 高井麻巳子}} (2010) * {{Nihongo|''Ushiroyubi Sasaregumi Uta no Daihyakka Sono 2: Takai Mamiko''|うしろゆびさされ組★うたの大百科 その2 高井麻巳子}} (2004) * {{Nihongo|''Takai Mamiko SINGLES Complete''|高井麻巳子 SINGLESコンプリート}} (2004) == Videos == * {{cite AV media |title=高井麻巳子ファースト・コンサート DO・RA・MA |trans-title=Mamiko Takai First Concert DO・RA・MA |language=ja | medium=Videotape | Japan]] | publisher=[[Pony Canyon]] | date=1987-07-05}} ==Further reading== * {{cite book |last=Watanabe |first=Tatsuo |date=July 5, 1987 |title=ソレイユ |trans-title=Soleil |language=ja |year=1987 revision.text:
{{Short description|American actress (1919–1964)}} {{Use American English|date=October 2021}} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2021}} {{More citations needed|date=May 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Renee Godfrey | image = Renee Godfrey in Terror by Night (1946).png | image_size = | alt = | caption = Godfrey in ''[[Terror by Night]]'' (1946) | birth_name = Renee Vera Haal | birth_date = {{Birth date|1919|09|01|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[New York City]], U.S. | death_date = {{Death date and age|1964|05|24|1919|09|01|mf=yes}} | death_place = [[Los Angeles, California]], U.S. | resting_place = [[Forest Lawn Memorial Park (Glendale)|Forest Lawn Memorial Park]], [[Glendale, California]] | other_names = Renee Haal | occupation = Actress and singer | years_active = 1940–1964 | notable_works = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Peter Godfrey (director)|Peter Godfrey]]
|1941}} | children = 3 }} '''Renee Godfrey''' (born '''Renee Vera Haal'''; September 1, 1919 – May 24, 1964) was an American stage and motion picture actress and singer. ==Early life== Godfrey was born September 1, 1919, in New York, with Dutch and French ancestry as the daughter of Emil Haall, a Dutch diamond merchant, and his wife.{{cite news|last1=Todd|first1=John|title=In Hollywood|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/20165304/renee_godfrey/|work=The Times|date=January 25, 1945|location=Indiana, Munster|page=6|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = May 17, 2018}} {{Open access}} ==Career== Beginning at age 11, she worked as a model, and as a sophomore in high school she switched to night classes so that she could model during the day. She posed for artist [[John La Gatta]] and photographers [[Edward Steichen]], [[Victor Keppler]], John Hutchins,{{cite news|title=Renee Haal Posed for $10 an Hour WITH Her Clothes|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/20165515/renee_godfrey/|work=The Des Moines Register|date=November 2, 1941|location=Iowa, Des Moines|page=Magazine - 3|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = May 17, 2018}} {{Open access}} and others. She appeared in advertisements that were published nationally, and she had the most-photographed hands and legs in New York.{{cite news|title=Perfect Model for 1942|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/20166138/renee_godfrey/|work=The Minneapolis Star|date=December 21, 1941|location=Minnesota, Minneapolis|page=Magazine - 5|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = May 17, 2018}} {{Open access}} When a film executive saw her image on a billboard, that led the way to her work in motion pictures. Godfrey was featured on both radio and television programs in Britain.{{cite news|title=One from London|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/20167799/renee_godfrey/|work=The Los Angeles Times|date=October 3, 1943|location=California, Los Angeles|page=50|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = May 17, 2018}} {{Open access}} She initially entered films at [[RKO]], working as '''Renee Haal''', and made her début in [[Sam Wood]]'s ''[[Kitty Foyle (film)|Kitty Foyle]]'' (1940). Also in 1940, she was selected by RKO as that studio's actress most likely to succeed in a film career.{{cite news|last1=Heffernan|first1=Harold|title='Infant Stars of 1941' Named by Movie Studios|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/20166519/hartford_courant/|work=Hartford Courant|date=October 6, 1940|location=Connecticut, Hartford|page=59|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = May 17, 2018}} {{Open access}} Her next movie, ''[[Unexpected Uncle]]'' (1941), was directed by Peter Godfrey, who also directed her in the romantic thriller [[Highways by Night]] in 1942.{{Citation needed|date=May 2018}} Her work in ''Unexpected Uncle'' resulted in her signing a long-term contract with RKO early in 1942.{{cite news|title=Sign Renee Haal|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/20167244/renee_godfrey/|work=The Times|date=January 25, 1942|location=Indiana, Munster|page=8|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = May 17, 2018}} {{Open access}} She began working as Renee Godfrey in ''[[Up in Arms (film)|Up in Arms]]'' (1944). During World War II, she and her husband entertained troops with amateur [[Magic (illusion)|magic]] shows that they put on through the [[USO]]. She continued working in small roles, such as Vivian Vedder in ''[[Terror by Night]]'' (1946), in which she sported a particularly unconvincing English accent, and Mrs. Stebbins in [[Stanley Kramer|Stanley Kramer's]] ''[[Inherit the Wind (1960 film)|Inherit the Wind]]''. She worked into the 1960s, appearing in ''[[Can-Can (film)|Can-Can]]'' and ''[[Tender Is the Night (film)|Tender Is the Night]]''. For the most part, however, Godfrey was out of view. Her director-husband, who had flourished on 50s TV, was in ill health by the end of the decade. Taking secretarial and real estate classes to help support the family income, Godfrey tried making a comeback of sorts, finding bit roles in the films. She was also a [[Guest appearance|guest player]] on such shows as ''[[Perry Mason (1957 TV series)|Perry Mason]]'', ''[[Hazel (TV series)|Hazel]]'', ''[[The Donna Reed Show]]'' and ''[[Wagon Train]]''. ==Personal life== In 1938, she went to [[London]] for a singing engagement and met the actor/director/screenwriter [[Peter Godfrey (director)|Peter Godfrey]],{{Citation needed|date=May 2018}} whom she married on August 6, 1941.{{cite news|title=Renee Haal Wed to Film Director|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/20167003/renee_godfrey/|work=The Los Angeles Times|date=August 7, 1941|location=California, Los Angeles|page=30|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = May 17, 2018}} {{Open access}} He was almost 20 years her senior.{{Citation needed|date=May 2018}} With primary focus on raising her three children (which included a set of twins), she was seen only sporadically on TV during the 1950s with guest roles on programs hosted by [[Loretta Young]] and [[Jane Wyman]]. ==Death== She died in Los Angeles, California, on 24 May 1964 from the effects of [[cancer]]. She was 44 years old.{{cite news|title=Actor's Wife|url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/20167973/renee_godfrey/|work=The Town Talk|date=May 26, 1964|location=Louisiana, Alexandria|page=15|via = [[Newspapers.com]]|accessdate = May 17, 2018}} {{Open access}} Her final performance in the film, ''[[Those Calloways]]'' was released posthumously. Her body was buried at [[Glendale, California|Glendale's]] [[Forest Lawn Memorial Park (Glendale)|Forest Lawn Memorial Park Cemetery]].{{cite book|last1=Wilson|first1=Scott|title=Resting Places: The Burial Sites of More Than 14,000 Famous Persons, 3d ed.|date=2016|publisher=McFarland|isbn=9781476625997|page=283|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=FOHgDAAAQBAJ&q=%22Renee+Haal%22&pg=PA283|accessdate=18 May 2018|language=en}} ==Filmography== {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} ===Films roles=== * ''[[Kitty Foyle: The Natural History of a Woman|Kitty Foyle]]'' (1940) - Shopgirl in Elevator (uncredited) * ''[[Let's Make Music]]'' (1941) - Helen, Chorus Girl (uncredited) * ''[[Citizen Kane]]'' (1941) - Nurse (uncredited) * ''[[Hurry, Charlie, Hurry]]'' (1941) - Josephine Whitley (as Renee Haal) * ''[[Unexpected Uncle]]'' (1941) - Carol West (as Renee Haal) * ''[[Wedded Blitz]]'' (1942) - (as Renee Haal) * ''[[Framing Father]]'' (1942) - Mary Adams (as Renee Haal) * ''[[Highways by Night]]'' (1942) - Ellen Cromwell * ''[[Up in Arms]]'' (1944) - Goldwyn Girl (uncredited) * ''[[Bedside Manner (film)|Bedside Manner]]'' (1945) - Stella Livingston * ''[[Terror by Night]]'' (1946) - Vivian Vedder * ''[[Winter Wonderland (film)|Winter Wonderland]]'' (1947) - Phyllis Simpson * ''[[Down Missouri Way]]'' (1946) - Gloria Baxter * ''[[French Leave (1948 film)|French Leave]]'' (1948) - Mimi * ''[[The Decision of Christopher Blake]]'' (1948) - Sheila, Actress in Play (uncredited) * ''[[Can-Can (film)|Can-Can]]'' (1960) - Dowager (uncredited) * ''[[Inherit the Wind (1960 film)|Inherit the Wind]]'' (1960) - Mrs. Stebbins * ''[[Tender Is the Night (film)|Tender Is the Night]]'' (1962) - Nurse (uncredited) * ''[[Those Calloways]]'' (1965) - Sarah Mellott (uncredited) (final film role) {{col-break}} ===Television roles=== * ''[[Duffy's Tavern]]'' (1 episode, 1954) - Renee * ''[[Dr. Hudson's Secret Journal]]'' (1 episode, 1955) - Nurse * ''[[The Star and the Story]]'' (1 episode, 1956) - Miss Harrington * ''[[Buffalo Bill, Jr.]]'' (2 episodes, 1956) - Linda Abbott * ''[[Letter to Loretta]]'' (1 episode, 1956) - Andree Chartaud * ''[[Fireside Theatre|Jane Wyman Presents The Fireside Theatre]]'' (2 episodes, 1957) - Dorothy / Mrs. Dioso * ''[[Zane Grey Theater]]'' (2 episodes, 1960) - Alicia * ''[[The Ann Sothern Show]]'' (1 episode, 1961) - Martha Newton * ''[[Frontier Circus]]'' (1 episode, 1962) - Stella * ''[[Hazel (TV series)|Hazel]]'' (1 episode, 1962) - Miss Lewis * ''[[The Donna Reed Show]]'' (1 episode, 1962) - Gloria * ''[[Perry Mason (1957 TV series)|Perry Mason]]'' (2 episodes, 1960–1962) - Lady Librarian / Miss Winslow * ''[[General Electric Theater]]'' (1 episode, 1962) - Ethel * ''[[The Alfred Hitchcock Hour]]'' (1 episode, 1962) - Hartman's Secretary {{col-end}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} {{Portal|Biography}} * {{IMDb name|0324021}} * [http://www.weblo.com/celebrity/available/Renee_Godfrey/378469/ Renee Godfrey at weblo.com] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090618160441/http://movies.nytimes.com/person/27357/Renee-Godfrey/biography Biography at New York Times online] {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Godfrey, Renee}} [[Category:1919 births]] [[Category:1964 deaths]] [[Category:Deaths from cancer in California]] [[Category:Actresses from New York (state)]] [[Category:Singers from New York (state)]] [[Category:American stage actresses]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:American film actresses]] [[Category:20th-century American actresses]] [[Category:20th-century American singers]] [[Category:20th-century American women singers]] [[Category:Burials at Forest Lawn Memorial Park (Glendale)]]

{{BLP refimprove|date=June 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Don Snow | image = | caption = | image_size = | alias = Jonn Savannah | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1957|01|13|df=y}} | birth_place = [[London]], England | death_date = | origin = [[Ipswich]], [[Suffolk]], England | occupation = Musician, producer | genre = [[Rock music|Rock]], [[pop music|pop]], [[new wave music|new wave]] | instrument = Vocals, keyboards, guitar, saxophone | years_active = 1978–present | label = | associated_acts = [[Procol Harum]], [[Squeeze (band)|Squeeze]], [[Tina Turner]], [[The Catch (British duo)|The Catch]], [[The Sinceros]], [[The Vibrators]] | website = {{URL|www.jonnsavannah.com}} }} '''Don Snow''' (born 13 January 1957 in [[London]]) is a British vocalist and multi-instrumentalist, who plays the [[Hammond organ]], piano, guitar, bass guitar, drums and saxophone. He is primarily known for his work with the [[New wave music|new wave]] bands [[Squeeze (band)|Squeeze]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=luBNAAAAIBAJ&sjid=H4sDAAAAIBAJ&pg=3248,2057795&dq=don-snow+squeeze&hl=en|title=British group Squeeze breaks up|last=Lewis|first=Barbara|date=13 November 1982|page=16|work=The Free Lance-Star|access-date=30 July 2012}}</ref> [[the Sinceros]] and [[The Catch (British duo)|the Catch]], as well as [[Procol Harum]]. He has also frequently toured with [[Van Morrison]] and has played the Hammond organ and piano on three of his albums.
==Career== He started his career in 1978 as an original member of the [[New wave music|new wave]]/[[power pop]] outfit [[the Sinceros]], who were signed to [[Epic Records]] and released a string of successful albums. Around this time, he also played with [[Lene Lovich]] and [[Bill Nelson (musician)|Bill Nelson]], before he joined [[Squeeze (band)|Squeeze]] in 1982, replacing [[Paul Carrack]]. At this time, he recorded with drummer [[Chris Whitten]] as [[The Catch (British duo)|the Catch]], releasing the single "25 Years" which reached number 3 on the German charts, sold half a million copies and stayed on the charts for 40 weeks. He also recorded with artists such as [[Judie Tzuke]], [[Tracey Ullman]], [[Nik Kershaw]], [[ABC (band)|ABC]] and [[Sheila Walsh (singer)|Sheila Walsh]].
In 1987, he joined [[Tina Turner]] for her [[Break Every Rule World Tour]] and recorded the album ''Live in Europe''. He also recorded with [[Roger Daltrey]], [[Tom Jones (singer)|Tom Jones]], [[Jimmy Somerville]], [[Chris Eaton (UK musician)|Chris Eaton]], [[Holly Johnson]], [[Boy George]], [[Jaki Graham]] and [[Gary Moore]]. On 11 June 1988, Snow played the first [[Nelson Mandela|Nelson Mandela benefit]] at the [[Wembley Arena]] along with [[Al Green]], [[Joe Cocker]], [[Natalie Cole]], [[Jonathan Butler]], [[Freddie Jackson]], and [[Ashford & Simpson]].
In 1990, Snow played with the [[John Lennon]] tribute band in [[Liverpool]], before he re-joined Squeeze in 1991 for touring. In 1992, after appearing on records by Tina Turner, Judie Tzuke, [[Thomas Anders]] and [[Heartland (band)|Heartland]], he played keyboards for [[Procol Harum]] and later played for [[Van Morrison]]. He joined Squeeze for the third time in 1995 and played with Morrison again in 1998.
Since 2000, he has recorded releases with [[Kylie Minogue]], [[Melanie C]], [[Joe Cocker]], [[Mark Owen]], [[Michael Ball (singer)|Michael Ball]], released several solo albums and recently produced Alexis Cunningham.
In December 1992, he changed his name to Jonn Savannah. He now lives in [[Medford, New Jersey]].

revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=January 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Caterina Bueno | image = | caption = | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date|1943|4|2}} | death_date = {{death date and age|2007|7|16|1943|4|2}} | origin = [[Fiesole]] (Italy) | instrument = Vocals | genre = [[Folk music|Folk]] | occupation = Singer | years_active = 1963–2007 | label = I dischi del sole, Fonit Cetra | associated_acts = | website = }} '''Caterina Bueno''' (April 2, 1943 – July 16, 2007) was an Italian singer and folk music historian.
==Biography== Starting in the 1960s, her research and performances of Italian folk songs, particularly those of [[Tuscany]], are credited to bringing a new awareness of Italian folk music.
Bueno was born in San Domenico di Fiesole to her Spanish father, painter [[Xavier Bueno]], and Swiss mother, the writer [[Julia Chamorel]]. She taught herself to play the guitar and collected folk records, generally of Tuscany origin. She became active at the l'[[Istituto Ernesto De Martino]] and later the magazine [[Nuovo Canzoniere Italiano]].
She has worked with many artists in her career including [[Francesco De Gregori]] who dedicated his song "Caterina" to her.<ref name="LAREP1">{{cite news | url=http://www.rockol.it/musicaitaliana.com/news/it/2007/07071702.html | title=Addio a Caterina Bueno | newspaper=[[la Repubblica]] | date=July 27, 2007 | accessdate=November 30, 2008 | url-status=dead | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110522111459/http://www.rockol.it/musicaitaliana.com/news/it/2007/07071702.html | archivedate=May 22, 2011 }}</ref>
==Albums== *1964 -''La brunettina – Canzoni, rispetti e stornelli toscani''- ([[I dischi del sole]]) *1968 – ''La veglia'' – (I dischi del sole) *1969 – ''La Toscana di Caterina'' – (I dischi del sole) *1970 – ''In giro per la Toscana'' – (Amico) *1973 – ''Eran tre falciatori'' – ([[Cetra|Fonit Cetra]]) *1974 – ''Se vi assiste la memoria'' – (Fonit Cetra) *1976 – ''Il trenino della "Leggera" '' – (Fonit Cetra) *1997 – ''Canti di maremma e d'anarchia'' – (Libera Informazione Editrice) *1998 – ''Caterina Bueno in spettacolo'' ''canzoni paradossali e storie popolari di dolente attualità'' (Supreme) *2001 – ''Caterina Bueno dal vivo'' ([[Compagnia Nuove Indye (CNI)]]) *2005 – ''Eran tre falciatori – Se vi assiste la memoria – Il trenino della "leggera"]'' ([[Warner Music]]) *2007 – ''Dal vivo / live – Firenze 1975'' Caterina Bueno e Coro degli Etruschi (Pegasus)
==Singles== *1976 – ''Italia bella mostrati gentile/La "Leggera"'' (from a television performance) – (Fonit Cetra)
Bueno was also featured in the 1999 Italian folk collection CD ''The Great Ladies of Italian Folk Music'' (Buda Musique)
==References and further reading== {{reflist}} *''Enciclopedia della canzone italiana'', di Autori Vari (a cura di Gino Castaldo), ed. Curcio, 1990; alla voce "Bueno, Caterina", di Ambrogio Sparagna, pag. 228 *{{cite news | url=http://www.ilcantastorie.info/primopiano_bueno.htm | title=Per Caterina Bueno, in occasione del conferimento del "Fiorino d'oro" | author=Agamennone , Maurizio | publisher=Il Cantastorie| accessdate=November 30, 2008}}
{{Authority control}}

revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=January 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- For individuals; see Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Saba Anglana | image = Saba Anglana.jpg | image_size = | caption = Saba Anglana in April 2011 | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Saba Anglana<ref name="official">[http://www.sabaanglana.com/ Saba Anglana official website]</ref> | alias = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1970|11|17}} | birth_place = [[Mogadishu]], Somalia | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = singer, actor | years_active = | label =
| website = {{URL|www.sabaanglana.com}} }}
'''Saba Anglana''' (born November 17, 1970) is a [[Somali people|Somali]]-Italian actress and international singer.
==Biography== Saba was born in [[Mogadishu]], the capital of [[Somalia]], during the country's [[Somali Democratic Republic|socialist period]]. Her mother was the daughter of an exiled Somali living in neighboring [[Ethiopia]]. Her father was a former commander in the [[Italian Armed Forces|Italian military]], who relocated to Somalia from Italy after the [[Second World War]].<ref name="Sjtlr">{{cite web|last=Michaels|first=Mitch|title=Saba – Jidka (The Line) Review|url=http://www.411mania.com/music/album_reviews/68072/Saba---Jidka-%28The-Line%29-Review.htm|publisher=411mania|accessdate=April 1, 2013}}</ref>
Due to Saba's father's senior martial background with the erstwhile colonial administration, he was regarded by Somalia's then military regime as a possible spy. The Anglanas were subsequently exiled to Italy, when she was still a child.<ref name="Sjtlr"/>
Saba was thereafter raised in Italy, where she later studied at the [[Sapienza University of Rome|Sapienza University]] in Rome. Her Somali roots, however, remained an important focus. She studied the [[Somali language]] with her mother, particularly the regional dialect of ''Xamar Weyne'', connecting with Somalia through music. Saba is a Muslim.<ref name="Sjtlr"/><ref>short strory on BBC Amharic website written about Saba on August 17/2, 019. https://www.bbc.com/amharic/news-49069302</ref>
==Career== Saba began her artistic career in the 1990s as an actress on Italian television. In a popular local TV series entitled ''La Squadra'', she played a policewoman of dual Somali-Italian heritage.<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gXezSlbp68o Video "La Squadra"</ref>
In 2007, Saba released her first studio album entitled ''Jidka: The Line'', in which she mixes the traditional sounds of her native Somalia with contemporary Italian flourishes.<ref>https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=18487119 Audio of "Jidka" song</ref>
==See also== *[[Elisa Kadigia Bove]] *[[Jonis Bashir]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.sabaanglana.com/ The official Website of Saba Anglana] *[http://www.spinner.com/2008/01/15/for-italian-somalian-musician-saba-fusion-is-not-a-dirty-word/ Article on Saba Anglana]
{{Authority control}}

{{Short description|Estonian vocalist and actress}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = | image = Vilgats, Kaire.IMG 20190820 150928.jpg | image_size = 250 | landscape = <!-- yes, if wide image, otherwise leave blank --> | alt = | caption = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1976|01|11|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Pärnu]], Estonia | death_date = <!-- {{death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|1976|01|11|df=y}} --> | death_place = | genre = {{flatlist|*[[Pop music|Pop]] *[[jazz]]}} | occupation = Singer, actress | instrument = | years_active = <!-- YYYY–YYYY (or –present) --> | label = | associated_acts = | website = }}
'''Kaire Vilgats''' (born 11 January 1976<ref>[https://www.ohtuleht.ee/831494/kaire-vilgats-mulle-voib-julgelt-tanaval-juurde-astuda-humoorikad-seigad-mulle-meeldivad] Kaire Vilgats: mulle võib julgelt tänaval juurde astuda, humoorikad seigad mulle meeldivad!</ref>) is an [[Estonia]]n vocalist and actress, known for numerous roles in stage musicals. Over the years, she has repeatedly participated in the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] as a backing vocalist for Estonian entries.
== Early life == Kaire Vilgats was born and spent her childhood in [[Pärnu]], a resort town in the south-west of Estonia, where she also went to school. She learnt the accordion in a music school before taking classes in singing.
== Career == Vilgats has later been trained in pop-jazz singing at the [[Georg Ots Music School]] in [[Tallinn]], with [[Silvi Vrait]] as her vocal coach.
In 1999, Vilgats was awarded third place in the [[Kaks takti ette]] contest for young singers, organized by [[Estonian Television]]. The winner of that season was an Estonian rock star, [[Tanel Padar]], with [[Eda-Ines Etti]] in second position. The same year, she was cast in the company of the Estonian production of the [[musical theatre|musical]] ''[[La Cage aux Folles (musical)|La Cage aux Folles]]'' which was her theatre début. A series of supporting roles in musicals were to follow.
Kaire Vilgats has been the musical director of the [[Estonian Puppet Theatre]] in [[Tallinn]], where she composed music for children's musicals and plays, like, ''The Little Witch'' by [[Otfried Preußler]].
In 2006, she was nominated for an Estonian theatre prize for the supporting role of Amps in the musical ''{{ill|Romeo & Julia (Estonian musical)|lt=Romeo & Julia|et|Romeo & Julia}}'' but did not win.
=== Roles === * 2000: ''[[Tanz der Vampire]]'' (Magda) * 2000: ''[[Little Shop of Horrors (musical)|Little Shop of Horrors]]'' (Crystal) * 2000: ''[[Zorba (musical)|Zorba]]'' (Storyteller) * 2001: ''[[No, No, Nanette]] (Betty from Boston) * 2001: ''[[Les Misérables (musical)|Les Misérables]]'' (Mme Thenardier, understudy) * 2002: ''[[Miss Saigon]]'' (Gigi) * 2003: ''[[Fiddler on the Roof]]'' (Golde) * 2004: ''[[Crazy for You (musical)|Crazy for You]]'' (Irene Roth) * 2006: ''[[Fame (musical)|Fame]]'' (Esther Sherman) * 2006: ''{{ill|Romeo & Julia (Estonian musical)|lt=Romeo & Julia|et|Romeo & Julia}}'' (Amps) * 2006: ''[[Lumekuninganna]]'' (Snow Queen) (Grandmother/Snow Queen) * 2007: ''[[Phantom (musical)|Phantom]]'' (Carlotta) * 2008: ''[[Anything Goes]]'' (Reno Sweeney) * 2008: ''[[Buratino senitundmatud seiklused]]'' ("Buratino`s Yet Unknown Adventures") (Malviina) * 2011: ''[[The Warewolf]]'' (Grandmother) * 2011: ''[[The Beauty and the Beast]]'' (Teapot) * 2011: ''[[Karlsson on the Roof]]'' (Hildur Sokk), drama * 2012: ''[[Seljatas sada meest]]'' ("Overcame a Hundred Men") (Maria Loorberg), drama * 2013: ''[[Shrek (musical)|Shrek]]'' (Dragon) * 2014: ''[[Koerhaldjas Mia]]'' (Dog-Fairy Mia) (Christmas Mom) * 2015: ''[[Billy Elliot (musical)|Billy Elliiot]]'' (Mrs Wilkinson) * 2015: ''[[Karlsson on the Roof]]'', the musical, (Hildur Sokk) * 2016: ''[[Mamma Mia (musical)|Mamma Mia]]'' (Rosie Mulligan / Tanya Chesham-Leigh) * 2017: ''[[Les Misérables (musical)|Les Misérables]]'' (Mme Thenardier)
As a chorist, Vilgats has appeared in ''[[Evita (musical)|Evita]]'', ''[[La Cage aux Folles (play)|La Cage aux Folles]]'', ''[[Georg (musical)|Georg]]'' and ''Mort''. She is also a voice actress and vocal coach.
== Other credits == Kaire Vilgats is a backing vocalist for different Estonian pop acts, such as [[Anne Veski]], [[Ivo Linna]] or [[Maarja-Liis Ilus|Maarja]].
With 7 appearances, she is holding the record of biggest number of participations in the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] for Estonia. In 2000 and 2002, she sang backing vocals for the Estonian and [[Malta|Maltese]] songs, and did the same for Estonia at 2014, 2016, 2017 and 2019 contests. The 2020 contest in [[Rotterdam]] she was to attend as a backing singer got cancelled due to the pandemic spread of coronavirus.
Vilgats provided her vocals for the album ''Family. We are Family'', released in 2003 as a cooperative effort of several popular vocalists, such as [[Nele-Liis Vaiksoo]] and [[Lauri Pihlap]]. She has also performed with the [[Estonian Police Orchestra]] and a number of other orchestras and groups.
Kaire Vilgats has been open about her weight problems and has therefore given patronage to sporting events, like [[Tartu Maraton]] in which she successfully participates. She has co-hosted and participated in TV-shows, ''[[Your Face Sounds Familiar]]'' among many.
In 2021, she had a small role in the [[Ergo Kuld]] directed comedy film ''Jahihooaeg''.<ref name="Aeg">{{cite web |url=https://menu.err.ee/1608180430/pildid-tallinnas-alustati-mangufilmi-jahihooaeg-votetega|title=Pildid: Tallinnas alustati mängufilmi "Jahihooaeg" võtetega|date=16 April 2021|work=[[Eesti Rahvusringhääling]]|accessdate=30 December 2021|language=et}}</ref>
== Personal life == Vilgats is a mother of three children, two sons and a daughter. She is divorced from a music producer Johannes Lõhmus.
Vilgats' mother is [[Ester Vilgats]], a news journalist for [[Estonian Public Broadcasting]].
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *{{IMDb name|1552531}}
{{Authority control}}

{{Use mdy dates|date=January 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Glenn Stetson | image = Publicity photo of canadian singer Glenn Stetson (The Diamonds) ca. 1966.jpg | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1940|11|12}} | birth_place = [[Ottawa Valley]], Ontario, Canada | death_date = {{Death date and age|2003|08|22|1940|11|12}} | death_place = [[Orlando, Florida]], United States | genre = [[Rock-n-roll]], [[Broadway theatre|broadway]], [[Country music|country]], pop | occupation = Singer, television producer, entertainer | years_active = 1959–2000 | instrument = | Notable_albums = | Notable songs = | label = | associated_acts = [[The Diamonds]]
[[Fred Waring]]
[[The Executives]] | website = }} '''Glenn Stetson''' (November 12, 1940 – August 22, 2003) was a Canadian singer, concert promoter and television producer. Glenn Campbell Stetson was born in the [[Ottawa Valley]] (Ramsayville) of eastern [[Ontario]] and raised in [[Hamilton, Ontario]]. He was a lead singer with [[The Diamonds]], whose hits included "[[The Stroll (song)|The Stroll]]", "[[Silhouettes]]", and "[[Little Darlin']]", from the late 1960s through the 1990s. He studied theater under Sir [[Tyrone Guthrie]], and appeared in the original [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] productions of "[[H.M.S Pinafore]]" and "[[Funny Girl (musical)|Funny Girl]]". In the mid-1960s, he was a featured performer for [[Fred Waring]] and the Pennsylvanians. He toured Vietnam in 1966 with the USO. In 1968, he joined the Diamonds and helped keep their name and music alive through the 1970s and 1980s and 1990s, particularly on oldies tours and TV. [[The Diamonds]] toured Australia heavily in the 1970s with Australian rock-n-roll legend [[Lonnie Lee]]. Stetson released a solo album in the 1970s entitled "Stetson Country" that was produced by Wayne Jackson of the famed [[Memphis Horns]]. He and the Diamonds were frequent guests on [[Nashville Now]] with host [[Ralph Emery]]. Stetson and Richard J. "Dick" Milano were founders of Little Darlin's Rock n’ Roll Palace in [[Kissimmee]], Florida (opened in 1986, closed in 1992) which was a highly popular [[Orlando, Florida|Orlando]]-area venue in the 1980s. He was co-executive producer for "Live at the Palace" (hosted by [[Wolfman Jack]]) on the Nashville Network (TNN). "Little Darlin's Rock-n-Roll Palace" and associated oldies tours revived the careers of many performers, notably Fabian, [[Dee Clark]], [[Tommy Sands (entertainer)|Tommy Sands]], [[The Shirelles]], [[Danny & the Juniors]], and [[The Tokens]]. He was also active in charitable fund-raising and civic organisations such as the [[Shriners]] of which he was an honorary member. Stetson received a heart transplant in 2000 as a result of [[myocarditis]]. However, his health began to deteriorate and he died undergoing an operation on August 22, 2003 in [[Orlando, Florida]]. ==Discography== ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable" ! Year ! Single ! width="45"| CAN Country |- | 1979 | "What Are We Doing" (with Lyoness and Judy Woodstock) | align="center"| 52 |} ==External links== *[https://www.variety.com/article/VR1117891979.html?categoryid=25&cs=1 Variety Obituary 2003] *[http://www.thedeadrockstarsclub.com/2003b.html Dead Rock Stars Club] *[http://www.cflradio.net/little_darlin%27s.htm "Little Darlin's" Rock and Roll Palace] Tribute page with photos and links. Retrieved September 20, 2013. {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stetson, Glenn}} [[Category:Musicians from Hamilton, Ontario]] [[Category:1940 births]] [[Category:Canadian people of English descent]] [[Category:Canadian pop singers]] [[Category:Canadian people of Scottish descent]] [[Category:Canadian people of Ulster-Scottish descent]] [[Category:Canadian television producers]] [[Category:Canadian country singers]] [[Category:2003 deaths]] [[Category:20th-century Canadian male singers]]

{{Infobox musical artist | name = Nippy Noya | image = Nipi Noya1.JPG | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | caption = | background = non_vocal_instrumentalist | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1946|2|27|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Sulawesi]] | origin = [[Indonesia]] | genre = [[Jazz fusion]] | occupation = [[Percussionist]], songwriter | instrument = [[Kalimba]], [[congas]], [[bongos]], [[Campana (musical instrument)|campana]], [[güiro]], [[cabasa]], [[shekere]], [[caxixi]], [[Triangle (musical instrument)|triangle]], [[berimbau]] | years_active = | label = | associated_acts = [[Massada (latin-rock band)|Massada]], The Globetrotters, [[The Kelly Family]] | website = <!-- {{URL|example.com}} --> }}
'''Nippy Noya''' (born 27 February 1946) is an [[Indonesia]]n, Netherlands-based [[percussionist]] and songwriter, specialising in [[congas]], [[kalimba]], [[bongos]], [[Campana (musical instrument)|campana]], [[güiro]], [[cabasa]], [[shekere]], [[caxixi]], [[Triangle (musical instrument)|triangle]] and the [[berimbau]].
==History==
Son of Japanese [[Taiko]] drummer Fusao San Nakato, he was born on the Indonesian island of [[Sulawesi]] and came to Europe in 1968. He began his professional career as a conga player in [[Amsterdam]] with percussion-rock band Massada. He played with them till 2016 on and off whilst becoming a sought-after musician; he made a one-off return for the recording of their 2018-released live dvd.
Artists he since played and recorded with include [[Peter Herbolzheimer]],<ref>[http://www.jazzprofessional.com/big_band_profiles/herbolzheimer.htm Jazz Professional] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080819202738/http://www.jazzprofessional.com/big_band_profiles/herbolzheimer.htm |date=August 19, 2008 }}</ref> [[John McLaughlin (musician)|John McLaughlin]], [[Jan Akkerman]], [[Hellmut Hattler]], [[Volker Kriegel]], [[Earth and Fire]], [[Stan Getz]] and [[Dick Morrissey]]. In addition he toured with [[Richard Tee]], [[Eric Burdon]], [[Billy Cobham]], Miko Aleksic<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=1yXVEjS-j8IC&dq=Nippy+Noya+AND+Allmusic&pg=PT250 |title=All Music Guide to Jazz |accessdate=27 December 2008|isbn=9780879307172 |year=2002 |last1=Bogdanov |first1=Vladimir |last2=Woodstra |first2=Chris |last3=Erlewine |first3=Stephen Thomas }}</ref> [[Chaka Khan]], [[Peter Maffay]], [[Udo Lindenberg]], [[Gitte Haenning]], [[John Hondorp]] and [[Herbert Grönemeyer]]. He also taught and performed with the young children of [[the Kelly Family]], from the mid-1980s until the mid-1990s. He appeared on several Kelly Family albums, VHSs and live shows.
Since 1992, he has been a lecturer at the Conservatory of Music in [[Enschede]], [[Netherlands]].
In 2001, Noya joined a Polish jazz/funky band The Globetrotters, consisting of vocalist Kuba Badach, vibrafonist Bernard Maseli, and saxophonist Jerzy Główczewski. The band has released several albums.<ref name="globetrotters">{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Globetrotters/158845989330?id=158845989330&sk=info |title=The Globetrotters – Info |publisher=[[Facebook]] |language=Polish |accessdate=9 November 2013}}</ref>
== Discography == *''To the World of the Future'' - [[Earth and Fire]] (1975) *''[[Eli (Jan Akkerman album)|Eli]]'' - [[Jan Akkerman]] and Kaz Lux (1976) *''Billy Cobham Live: Flight Time'' - Billy Cobham (1980) *''[[Ark (The Animals album)|Ark]]'' - [[The Animals]] (1983) *''Live'' - [[The Kelly Family]] (1988) *''Keep on Singing...'' - [[The Kelly Family]] (1989) *''Live in East Germany'' - [[The Kelly Family]] (1989, VHS) *''New World'' - [[The Kelly Family]] (1990) *''[[Honest Workers]]'' - [[The Kelly Family]] (1991) *''Streetlife'' - [[The Kelly Family]] (1992) *''WOW'' - [[The Kelly Family]] (1993) *''The Traveler'' - Billy Cobham (1993)
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links == *{{IMDb name|1069951}} *[http://www.artez.nl/Conservatorium/Docenten/Noya Webpage at ArtEZ Conservatory]

{{short description|South Korean actress}} {{family name hatnote|Oh||lang=Korean}} {{Infobox person | name = Oh Yeon-seo | image = Oh Yeonseo Marie Claire Korea 2021 5.png | image_size = 250 | caption = Oh in 2021 | birth_name = Oh Haet-nim | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1987|06|22}} | birth_place = [[Jinju]], [[South Gyeongsang Province]], South Korea | education = [[Dongguk University]] | occupation = {{hlist|Actress|singer|model}} | years_active = 2002–present | agent = Story J Company | height = 170cm | module = {{Infobox musical artist|embed=yes | alias = Haetnim | genre = {{hlist|[[K-pop]]|[[dance-pop]]}} | instrument = Vocals | years_active = 2002–2003 | label = [[iHQ (company)|SidusHQ]] | past_member_of = [[Luv (group)|Luv]] }} | module2 = {{Infobox Korean name|child=yes|headercolor=transparent | hangul = {{linktext|오|연|서}} | hanja = {{linktext|吳|漣|序}}{{Cite web|url=http://tmp.castnet.co.kr/audition/news/news_view.php?_Number=2583&_Page=20|title=흐르는 강물처럼 성장하고 싶은 배우, 오연서|website=Movieweek|via=CastNet|author=남은경|date=June 2, 2008|accessdate=November 21, 2022|language=ko}}
{{linktext|吳|沇|序}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.newsen.com/news_view.php?uid=201210170027200510|title=오연서 “본명 오햇님, 일 안풀려 개명 1년간 효과?”|publisher=Newsen|author=하수정|date=October 17, 2012|accessdate=November 21, 2022|language=ko}}
{{linktext|吳|連|序}}{{Cite web|url=https://garageplay.tw/news/content/4215/|title= 馬東石親任製片身兼主演！攜手《犯罪都市2》團隊打造年度爆笑鉅獻《整形帝王》 馬東石宣布結婚後首部作品！《整形帝王》宣傳預告吸112萬觀看人次！ 馬東石竟要《機智醫生生活》鄭敬淏為他隆鼻？！ 鄭敬淏拍完《整形帝王》有了好哥哥馬東石、好姐姐吳娜拉！ 《整形帝王》12月2日 當我塑膠|website=GaragePlay|author=|date=November 11, 2022|accessdate=November 21, 2022|language=zh-tw}} | rr = O Yeon-seo | mr = O Yŏnsŏ | hangulborn = {{linktext|오|햇|님}} | hanjaborn = {{linktext|吳|햇|님}} | rrborn = O Haet-nim | mrborn = O Haetnim }} }} '''Oh Yeon-seo''' ({{Korean|오연서}}, born '''Oh Haet-nim''' [{{Korean|오햇님|labels=no}}]; June 22, 1987), is a South Korean actress, singer and model and is best known for her roles in television dramas ''[[My Husband Got a Family]]'' (2012), ''[[Jang Bo-ri is Here!]]'' (2014), ''[[Shine or Go Crazy]]'' (2015), ''[[Come Back Mister]]'' (2016), [[My Sassy Girl (TV series)|''My Sassy Girl'']] (2017), ''[[A Korean Odyssey]]'' (2017–18), ''[[Love with Flaws]]'' (2019–20), ''[[Mad for Each Other]]'' (2021), and ''[[Café Minamdang]]'' (2022). == Early life == Oh was born in [[Jinju]], [[South Gyeongsang Province]] and grew up in [[Changnyeong County]]. In the second year of middle school, Oh followed a group of friends to an audition for [[SM Entertainment]], held in [[Daegu]], but was rejected. However, another company contacted her saying that she had qualified and she moved to Seoul, debuting four months later at the age of 15.{{citation needed|date=January 2019}} Oh was accepted into Anyang Arts High School after her band's disbandment and went on to become an actress. She changed her name from Haet-nim to Yeon-seo after consulting a shaman with her mother.{{cite web|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=3027585|title=Young people are taking up new names|work=Korea JoongAng Daily|date=19 December 2016}} Oh then entered [[Dongguk University]], joining the theater and film department.{{cite web|url=https://entertain.naver.com/read?oid=213&aid=0000933264|title=김주현 "대학동기 오연서 '엽기녀' 발탁, 내가봐도 잘어울려"[인터뷰③]|date=15 December 2016|website=TV Report|language=ko}} ==Career== ===Beginnings=== Oh Yeon-seo made her entertainment debut in 2002 when she was 15-years-old under her birth name Oh Haet-nim, with the [[IHQ (company)|SidusHQ]]-managed band [[Luv (group)|Luv]]. They released their first album, ''Story'', with the singles "Orange Girl" and "I Still Believe in You".{{cite web|url=http://news.donga.com/BestClick/3/all/20140919/66511752/1|script-title=ko:오연서-전혜빈, 걸그룹 러브 데뷔곡 ‘오렌지걸’ 무대 재현 “상큼”|date=19 September 2009|work=The Donga Ilbo|access-date=2014-11-13|language=ko|trans-title=Oh Yeon-seo - Jeon Hye-bin, girl group LUV makes a 'refreshing' reappearance on stage with debut song 'Orange Girl'}} The band was short-lived and disbanded six months later. Oh then shifted to acting and made her debut appearance in the 2003 drama ''[[Sharp (TV series)|Sharp]]'', but remained unknown.{{cite web|url=http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/search1/2603000000.html?cid=AEN20160523003500315|title=(News Focus) Ex-singers get second chances as actresses|work=Yonhap News Agency|date=23 May 2016}} ===2012–2013: Rising popularity=== Though she had a major role in the 2009 film ''[[A Blood Pledge]]'',{{cite web|url=http://news.maxmovie.com/45354|title=[인터뷰] <여고괴담5-동반자살> 오연서 "첫 주연, 떨리지만 뿌듯해요" |date=15 June 2009|website=Max Movie|language=ko}} it wasn't until she was cast in the family drama ''[[My Husband Got a Family]]'' (2012) that she gained recognition.{{cite web|url=https://entertain.naver.com/read?oid=312&aid=0000013799|title=오연서│<넝쿨째 굴러온 당신> 가족들에 대한 세 가지 이야기|date=16 May 2012|website=TenAsia|language=ko}} She then joined the popular variety program ''[[We Got Married]]'' alongside MBLAQ's [[Lee Joon]].{{Cite web|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2959031|title=Lee Joon and Oh Yeon-seo "gets married"|work=Korea JoongAng Daily|date=7 September 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tenasia.com/archives/12027|title=MBLAQ's Lee Joon, Oh Yeon-seo to enjoy married life as new couple on MBC's ''We Got Married''|last=Hong|first=Lucia|date=6 September 2012|work=10Asia|access-date=2013-07-24}} Towards the end of 2012, Oh was cast in daily drama ''[[Here Comes Mr. Oh]]'' where she had her first lead role.{{cite web|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2960601|title=Lee Jang-woo, Oh Yeon-seo on MBC|date=11 October 2012|website=Korea JoongAng Daily}} In 2013, Oh played a thoracic resident surgeon in medical drama ''[[Medical Top Team]]''.{{cite web|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2976488|title=Oh Yeon-seo reveals boyish look|date=23 August 2012|website=Korea JoongAng Daily}}{{cite web|url=http://koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2013/07/398_139980.html|title=Jung, Oh to join Medical Top Team|work=The Korea Times|date=26 July 2013}} She was appointed an ambassador for the first annual Animal Film Festival in [[Suncheon]] along with [[Kim Min-jun (actor)|Kim Min-jun]] and [[Kal So-won]] to help raise awareness for animal rights and welfare in August.{{cite web|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2976547|title=Korea's first animal film fest kicks off in Suncheon|date=23 August 2013|publisher=Korea JoongAng Daily|access-date=2014-11-13}} Oh was also appointed a Red Cross Ambassador together with actor [[Ryu Soo-young]].{{cite web|url=http://app.yonhapnews.co.kr/YNA/Basic/ForeignGallery/view.aspx?lang=EN&contents_id=PYH20140508057300315|title=Oh Yeon-seo made Korean Red Cross Ambassador|date=8 May 2014|website=[[Yonhap News Agency]]|access-date=14 July 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180107061434/http://app.yonhapnews.co.kr/YNA/Basic/ForeignGallery/view.aspx?lang=EN&contents_id=PYH20140508057300315|archive-date=7 January 2018|url-status=dead}} ===2014–present: Breakthrough=== Oh played the lead role of Jang Bo-ri, a compassionate and selfless person, in the highly acclaimed series ''[[Jang Bo-ri is Here!]]'' (2014). The drama's ratings peaked at 40.4%, and led to a surge in popularity for Oh. She had a hard time playing the character as she grew up in Gyeongsang-do but her character had to speak the Jeolla-do dialect, which she had never used in her entire life.{{cite web|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2014/09/06/2014090600544.html|title=Oh Yeon-seo Basks in TV Drama's Success|work=The Chosun Ilbo|date=6 September 2014}} In 2015, Oh played Shin Yool, the last princess of [[Balhae]], in the historical drama ''[[Shine or Go Crazy]],'' co-starring [[Jang Hyuk]].{{cite web|title=Jang Hyuk & Oh Yeon Seo coming back with a new drama called ''Shine or Go Crazy''|url=http://en.starnnews.com/news/index.html?no=353279|website=StarN News|date=16 January 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://kpopherald.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=201412232112229543573_2&ACE_SEARCH=1|title=Jang Hyuk, Oh Yeon-seo have romantic encounter in 'To Shine or to Go Insane'|work=Kpop Herald|date=23 December 2014}} The series was a modest hit, and topped ratings in its timeslot throughout its run.{{cite web|url=http://kpopherald.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=201504081744175794093_2&ACE_SEARCH=1|title='Shine or Go Crazy' concludes with highest TV ratings|work=Kpop Herald|date=8 April 2015}} Oh then starred alongside [[Rain (entertainer)|Rain]] in the [[Seoul Broadcasting System|SBS]] drama ''[[Please Come Back, Mister]]'', which aired from February to April, 2016. She played Han Hong-nan, a male character reincarnated in a female's body. Oh was praised for her chemistry with co-star [[Lee Ha-nui]], whom she has acted with in her previous project ''Shine or Go Crazy''.{{cite web|url=http://entertain.naver.com/read?oid=117&aid=0002735481|title=[MD포커스] '돌아저씨' 오연서 이하늬, 베스트커플상 가나요|date=11 March 2016|work=My Daily|language=ko}} She also impressed viewers through her comedic portrayal of her masculine role.{{Cite web|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=3018119|title=Oh impresses in masculine role|access-date=2016-05-19|date=29 April 2016|website=Korea JoongAng Daily}} The same year, she starred in ''Take Off 2'', the sequel to the 2009 movie ''[[Take Off (2009 film)|Take Off]]'' where she plays a member of the first South Korean woman's national ice hockey team.{{cite web|url=http://kpopherald.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=201508201447512566744_2&ACE_SEARCH=1|title=Oh Dal-su, Oh Yeon-seo join the cast for 'Take Off 2'|work=Kpop Herald|date=20 August 2015}} In 2017, Oh starred in the [[My Sassy Girl (TV series)|historical drama remake]] of the 2001 box office hit ''[[My Sassy Girl]]'' alongside [[Joo Won]].{{cite web|url=http://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/art/2017/06/688_230937.html|title=Daredevil female characters grace screens big and small|work=The Korea Times|date=9 June 2017}} In August 2017, Oh signed with new management agency Celltrion Entertainment.{{cite web|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=3036658|title=Actor Oh Yeon-seo signs with new agency|date=3 August 2016|work=Korea JoongAng Daily}} The same year, she was cast in tvN's fantasy romantic comedy/tragedy drama ''[[A Korean Odyssey]]'', written by the [[Hong sisters]].{{cite web|url=http://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/art/2018/01/398_243250.html|title=Love tug of war - monkey king and monk|date=29 January 2018|website=The Korea Times}} In 2018, Oh starred in the film adaptation of the ''[[Cheese in the Trap]]'' alongside [[Park Hae-jin]], who also played the role of Yoo Jung in the drama.{{cite web|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=3045404&cloc=joongangdaily|title=Film version of 'Cheese' is a thrilling romance|date=9 March 2018|website=Korea JoongAng Daily}}{{cite web|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2018/03/17/2018031700390.html|title=Actress Oh Yeon-seo Admits She Feels Pressure with Age|date=17 March 2018|website=The Chosun Ilbo}} [[File:Oh Yeonseo Marie Claire Korea 2021 3.png|thumb|Oh for Marie Claire Korea in 2021]] In 2019, Oh was cast in the romantic comedy drama ''[[Love with Flaws]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.newsen.com/news_view.php?uid=201905131442338010|title=MBC 측 "안재현X오연서 '하자있는 인간들' 11월 수목극 편성"(공식입장)|date=13 May 2019|website=Newsen|language=ko|author=Park Soo-in}} In October 2019, Oh re-signed with [[IHQ (company)|SidusHQ]].{{cite web|url=http://osen.mt.co.kr/article/G1111240679|title=오연서, 싸이더스 전속계약 체결...장혁·김하늘·김우빈 한솥밥 [공식]|date=14 October 2019|website=OSEN|language=ko|author=Yeon Hwi-seon}} In 2021, Oh was cast in the web drama ''[[Mad for Each Other]]'' which premiered on May 24 alongside [[Jung Woo]].{{cite web|url= https://n.news.naver.com/entertain/now/article/029/0002635789 |title= 정우ㆍ오연서 유쾌상쾌 로맨스|website=Naver|date=November 11, 2020|access-date=August 24, 2022}} Later in November 2021, Oh officially signed with Story J Company.{{cite web|url=https://entertain.naver.com/now/read?oid=477&aid=0000326890|author=Jung Yu-jin|title=오연서, 스토리제이컴퍼니와 전속계약…김태희‧김정현‧고수 한솥밥[공식]|trans-title=Oh Yeon-seo, an exclusive contract with Story J Company... Kim Tae-hee, Kim Jeong-hyeon, Gosu One Pot Rice [Official]|publisher=Spotify News |via = Naver |date=November 3, 2021|access-date= November 3, 2021|language=ko}} In 2022, she was cast in ''[[Café Minamdang]]'' as Han Jae-hui, a third-year homicide detective, alongside [[Seo In-guk]].{{cite web|url=https://www.hancinema.net/seo-in-guk-and-oh-yeon-seo-to-star-in-minamdang--case-note-155861.html|title=Seo in-guk and Oh Yeon-seo to Star in "Minamdang - Case Note"|publisher=SpoTV News|website=HanCinema|date=November 17, 2021|access-date=February 22, 2022|archive-date=February 22, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220222123623/https://www.hancinema.net/seo-in-guk-and-oh-yeon-seo-to-star-in-minamdang--case-note-155861.html|url-status=live}}later in the same year Oh has returned to the big screen, with the film ''[[Men of Plastic]]'', which will be released in November with [[Ma Dong-seok]], [[Jung Kyung-ho (actor, born 1983)|Jung Kyung-ho]] and [[Oh Na-ra]].{{cite web|url=https://entertain.naver.com/read?oid=117&aid=0003667614|last=Kim|first=Na-ra|title='압꾸정' 마동석X정경호→오연서, 자양강장제 케미|trans-title='Apkkoojeong' Ma Dong-seok X Jung Kyung-ho → Oh Yeon-seo, tonic chemistry|work=My Daily|via=Naver|date=November 14, 2022|access-date=November 15, 2022|language=ko}} ==Personal life== On March 29, 2018, it was confirmed that Oh is in a relationship with actor [[Kim Bum]].{{cite web|url=http://entertain.naver.com/now/read?oid=404&aid=0000207195|title=오연서 측, 김범과 열애 초고속 인정 "호감 갖고 알아가는 단계"(공식)|date=29 March 2018|website=Naver|publisher=enews24|language=ko}}{{cite web|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20180329000375|title=Oh Yeon-seo, Kim Beom confirm relationship|date=29 March 2018|website=The Korea Herald}}{{cite web|url=http://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/art/2018/03/688_246409.html|title=Actress Oh Yeon-seo, actor Kim Beom 'in early blush of romance'|date=29 March 2018|website=The Korea Times}} However, after a few months of dating they were reported to have parted ways.{{cite web|url=http://news1.kr/articles/?3546615|title=[단독] 김범·오연서, 열애 인정 10개월만에 '결별'|date=13 February 2019|website=News1|author= Jeong Yu-jin|language=ko}}{{cite web|url=http://sports.donga.com/3/all/20190213/94087389/1|title=[종합] 김범·오연서, 열애 10개월 만에 동료로…"지난해 결별"|date=13 February 2019|website=Sports revision.text:
{{copyedit|date=March 2022}} {{Infobox person | name = Izhar Qazi | image = | imagesize = | caption = Mohammad Ashiq Ali | birth_name = Izhar Qazi | birth_date = 16 September 1955 | birth_place = Khadda Market, [[Karachi, Pakistan]] {{flagicon|Pakistan}} | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|2007|12|23|1955|09|16}} | death_place = Gulistan-e-Jauhar, [[Karachi, Pakistan]] {{flagicon|Pakistan}} | restingplace = Model Colony graveyard, Karachi, Pakistan {{flagicon|Pakistan}} | restingplacecoordinates = | othername = | occupation = {{hlist|[[Actor]]|[[Singer]]}} | yearsactive = 1982-2005 | spouse = | domesticpartner = | children = | parents = | website = | awards = Nigar Award (2 times), National Award, Graduate Award, Bolan Award }}
'''Izhar Qazi''' (16 September 1955 – 23 December 2007) was a [[Pakistani]] film and television actor and singer.
He acted in more than 100 movies and numerous TV plays, in the latter category his last major release being [[Syed Noor]]’s ''Zakham'' (1993), playing a [[Vigilantism|vigilante]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=25 December 2007 |title=Renowned actor Izhar Qazi dies |url=http://old.paktribune.com/news/Renowned-actor-Izhar-Qazi-dies-195821.html |website=PakTribune}}</ref>
His most famous movies were ''Love In Nepal'', ''Aalmi Jasoos'', ''Khazana'' and ''Sar Kata Insaan''.
He was a two-time recipient of the prestigious [[Nigar award]].
Most of his films were in [[Urdu]] but he also appeared in several double version [[Urdu]]-[[Punjabi language|Punjabi]] films and in one [[Pushto|Pashto]] film, ''Ghunghru do Kalashankoff.''<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |title=Izhar Qazi - film records |url=https://pakmag.net/film/artist/IzharQazi.php |access-date=2022-03-03 |website=pakmag.net}}</ref>
He was a singer as well, and he recorded one album which was not well received.
==Career beginnings== Qazi was born in [[Khadda Market]], Karachi. He began his professional career as an engineer at [[Pakistan Steel Mills]] but was later introduced to the famous TV drama writer [[Fatima Surayya Bajia|Fatima Suraiyya Bajia]] by his manager, Syed Abdul Munim.<ref name="images">{{Cite web |title=A disheartened thespian bows out -DAWN Images; December 30, 2007 |url=http://www.dawn.com/weekly/images/archive/071230/images4.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090425000828/http://www.dawn.com/weekly/images/archive/071230/images4.htm |archive-date=2009-04-25 |access-date=2008-11-30}}</ref> Bajia was looking for a new face for television at that time Qazi's striking resemblance with Indian film actor Amitabh Bachchan immediately caught her attention.<ref name="images" /><ref name="jahan">{{Citation |title=2007 takes away Izhar Qazi as well |date=2007-02-02 |url=http://www.akhbar-e-jehan.com/181/izharqazi.php |newspaper=Akhbar-e-Jehan |pages=60 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090424203934/http://www.akhbar-e-jehan.com/181/izharqazi.php |access-date=2008-11-30 |archive-date=2009-04-24 |url-status=dead}}</ref> She invited him to audition and he made his television debut in 1982, starring in the family television drama serial ''Ana''.<ref name="images" /> He appeared as the romantic lead alongside another newcomer, Mehreen Ilahi, as well as alongside veteran television performers Shakeel and [[Ghazala Kaifee]].<ref name="jahan" /> He later appeared in the serials Daira and Gardish, appearing again with Shakeel and the late Pakistani actor [[Saqi (actor)|Saqi]].<ref name="jahan" />
Qazi's last acting role was in the private TV serial ''Pani Pe Naam.'' The series aired on PTV. <ref name="images" /><ref name=":1">{{Cite web |url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=story_28-9-2005_pg7_47 |title=Daily Times - Leading News Resource of Pakistan |access-date=2008-11-30 |archive-date=2009-04-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090424201505/http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=story_28-9-2005_pg7_47 |url-status=live }}</ref>
==Film== After achieving television success, Qazi transitioned into the [[Lollywood]] film industry in 1986. His film debut as the lead role in Nazar Shabab's ''Ruby,'' alongside veteran co-stars [[Mustafa Qureshi]], [[Shafi Mohammad]], [[Sabeeta]] and [[Saeed Khan Rangeela|Rangeela]]. The film was met with critical acclaim.<ref name="images" /><ref name="jahan" />
Qazi's role in the film was also notable because [[Jawed Sheikh|Jawed Shiekh]] had originally been cast for the lead role but quit in order to travel to [[India]] with [[Salma Agha]]. <ref name="jahan" /> Around the same time, Jawed had also been cast as Izhar for the film ''Bangkok'' ''Ke Chor.'' Director [[Jan Mohammad]] fired Jawed and awarded the role to Qazi.<ref name="jahan" />
In his third movie, ''Love in Nepal'' (1987) Qazi acted opposite Shabnam, Pakistan's top film actress at that time in a unique young-to-old character role.<ref name=":0" />
His collaborations with Jan Muhammad included popular films including ''Manila ki bijlyan'', ''Roop ki rani,'' and ''Choron ka baadshah''.<ref name="jahan" /> He also teamed up with the [[Sultan Rahi]] in a series of Punjabi films such as ''Abdullah the Great'', ''Irada'', ''Gujjar baadshah'', ''Lahori baadshah'', ''Pajero group'', ''Ghunda,'' and ''Dilari''.<ref name="jahan" /> Hence he was more of an action hero than a romantic one.<ref name="images" /> His only [[SciFi|science fiction]] film, ''Sar kata insaan'', in which he played the role of a police investigator, won 8 Nigar Awards.
==Retirement== Qazi retired from the film industry in 2003 because he was dismayed by the poor quality of [[Lollywood]] films and by local film industry politics.<ref name="dawn">{{cite web| url = http://www.dawn.com/2007/12/25/local5.htm| title = KARACHI: Actor Izhar Qazi passes away - Newspaper - DAWN.COM| date = 25 December 2007}} </ref> He then concentrated on his real estate business.<ref name="dawn" />
== Awards and recognition == Qazi was nominated for best actor at the 2004 [[Lux Style Awards]].<ref name="images" /><ref name=":1" /> He also won the Graduate Award and Bolan Award.<ref name="news">{{cite web |title=The News International: Latest News Breaking, Pakistan News |url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/daily_detail.asp?id=87735}} awards</ref> He was awarded the prestigious [[Nigar Awards]] for his performances in ''Sakhi baadshan'' and ''Bakhtawar''.<ref name="images" /><ref name="jahan" /> He also received the National Award for best actor for his role in Masood Butt's ''Chiragh Bali''.<ref name="jahan" />
==Personal life== Qazi had four daughters and a son.[http://www.dawn.com/2007/12/25/local5.htm] He was active in several literary organizations.<ref name="jahan" />
==Death== On 23 December 2007, he suffered a heart attack while singing at the wedding of his sister-in-law in [[Gulistan-e-Jauhar]], Karachi<ref name="news" /><ref name="thepost">http://www.thepost.com.pk/Arc_MainNews.aspxbdtl_id=8672&fb_id=2&catid=14&date=12/25/2007&fcatid=14 {{Dead link|date=January 2020 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He died two hours later at a local hospital.<ref name="news" /> His funeral prayers were offered at Masjid Darul Khair, Gulistan-i-Jauhar and he was buried at [[Model Colony]] graveyard the next day.<ref name="news2">{{Cite web |url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/updates.asp?id=34475 |title=Renowned actor Izhar Qazi dies |access-date=2008-11-30 |archive-date=2009-04-25 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090425014323/http://www.thenews.com.pk/updates.asp?id=34475 |url-status=live }}</ref>
==Filmography==
